title: Recovered Risk (Data Lost During Migration)
Phishing emails and correspondence
description: The data could be used to impersonate the individual or access their account. Staff are trained on how to recognise and respond to phishing emails.
threatDescription: A member of staff could give away sensitive data or credentials to attackers.

title: Breach of AWS accounts
description: A breach could constitute a risk for access to sensitive data, data manipulation, business disruption and additional cost for services used on our account by an attacker. AWS console accounts have MFA enforced.
threatDescription: AWS accounts can be breached either via API credentials or console login.

title: AI risk of impersonation and deep fakes
description: Deep fake technology could be used to create convincing audio or video impersonations of staff, leading to social engineering attacks, fraudulent financial transactions, or reputational damage. Staff should verify unusual requests through alternative channels.
threatDescription: Malicious actors could use AI-generated content such as deep fakes to impersonate executives, employees or trusted partners to commit fraud or gain unauthorized access.

title: Malicious access to Office 365 account
description: Compromised accounts could lead to data exfiltration, email fraud, or lateral movement within the organization. MFA is enforced on all Office 365 accounts to reduce this risk.
threatDescription: An attacker could gain unauthorized access to an employee's Office 365 account through credential theft, phishing, or password reuse.

title: Increased risk of phishing as company grows
description: More employees means more potential targets for phishing attacks. Staff training and awareness programs are essential to mitigate this evolving risk.
threatDescription: As the company grows and expands its operations, the attack surface for phishing attempts increases proportionally.

title: QR code tampering on charge points
description: Customers scanning a tampered QR code could be directed to a fraudulent payment site, resulting in financial loss and reputational damage to the company. Periodic inspection of charge points should be conducted.
threatDescription: Malicious actors could place fraudulent QR codes over legitimate payment QR codes on EV charge points.

title: Difficulty managing existing clients, on-boarding new clients, billing and general loss of important information
description: Difficulty managing existing clients, on-boarding new clients, billing and general loss of important information
threatDescription: Loss, corruption or theft of client contracts, invoices and other client records
mitigationDescription: Enforce laptops going home at the end of each day with staff for the duration of the work (currently best-efforts policy). This reduces the assets available for theft. (A 7.1 A 5.30) (E I2-138)

title: Risk Prepare for multi-region deployment in both replicated and non-replicated configurations. (A 18.1.1
Risk Windows Defender can be enabled as a decent AV fallback

Risk We have process review ongoing including stronger payment controls into our supplier chain.,Malicious or disingenuous for payment whereby we transfer out money without proper due diligence (including dual sign-off).,Very few individuals can pay out
Risk Staff also have access to only the information needed to complete their job function

Either of these individuals could take decrypted cardholder data and sell or use the data for some profit, exposing the company to massive regulatory concerns, reputational damage, and financial losses.
description: Either of these individuals could take decrypted cardholder data and sell or use the data for some profit, exposing the company to massive regulatory concerns, reputational damage, and financial losses.
threatDescription: Two individuals (CISO and Lead DevSecOps Engineer) have the capability to decrypt cardholder data as they have administrative access to the Cardholder Data Environment.

title: If a breach of personal data occurred we have obligations to notify the relevant payment schemes (e.g. Visa, Mastercard, Amex) to avoid facing fines and to maintain our compliance such that acquirers and merchants will still allow us to process their card payments.
description: If a breach of personal data occurred we have obligations to notify the relevant payment schemes (e.g. Visa, Mastercard, Amex) to avoid facing fines and to maintain our compliance such that acquirers and merchants will still allow us to process their card payments.
threatDescription: In the case of a cardholder data breach a notification needs to be made to the relevant payment schemes to avoid fines and legal ramifications.

title: If we do not maintain up-to-date and accurate information on industry threats and security environment changes then we run a risk of not maintaining a suitably secure environment, opening ourselves up to compromise and may miss out on regulatory changes, opening ourselves up to legal repercussions.
description: If we do not maintain up-to-date and accurate information on industry threats and security environment changes then we run a risk of not maintaining a suitably secure environment, opening ourselves up to compromise and may miss out on regulatory changes, opening ourselves up to legal repercussions.
threatDescription: Maintaining up-to-date information on security threats, industry changes, and our security environment.

title: Devices could contain sensitive company information which we need to control and we may lose the ability to control when the device leaves the organisation. There is also a direct monetary cost for devices leaving the organisation, when they could instead be re-issued.
description: Devices could contain sensitive company information which we need to control and we may lose the ability to control when the device leaves the organisation. There is also a direct monetary cost for devices leaving the organisation, when they could instead be re-issued.
threatDescription: Laptops and phones not being returned after termination of employment.

title: If evidence of a security incident or breach is not properly maintained an attacker could cover their tracks making it hard to find the culprit, it could be hard to identify the source of the attack or the vulnerability exploited, and it may be difficult to establish the full extent of compromise to guide recovery efforts effectively.
description: If evidence of a security incident or breach is not properly maintained an attacker could cover their tracks making it hard to find the culprit, it could be hard to identify the source of the attack or the vulnerability exploited, and it may be difficult to establish the full extent of compromise to guide recovery efforts effectively.
threatDescription: Evidence of a security incident must be retained for further investigation.

title: Failure to report an information security event could have severe repercussions if the event turns out to have a substantial impact. If staff do not have a simple and well known route to report an information security event our chances of missing an event which results in a substantial impact increases.
description: Failure to report an information security event could have severe repercussions if the event turns out to have a substantial impact. If staff do not have a simple and well known route to report an information security event our chances of missing an event which results in a substantial impact increases.
threatDescription: Information security events must be reported.

title: If staff are not aware of their responsibilities to maintain the software patches on their laptops and mobile phones which connect to company resources then security vulnerabilities may not be patched in a timely manner increasing the potential for these vulnerabilities to be exploited.
description: If staff are not aware of their responsibilities to maintain the software patches on their laptops and mobile phones which connect to company resources then security vulnerabilities may not be patched in a timely manner increasing the potential for these vulnerabilities to be exploited.
threatDescription: Equipment which is not properly maintained may expose vulnerabilities which malicious actors could exploit.

title: Unauthorised access, delayed incident response, or regulatory non-compliance, leading to reputational and financial damage.
description: Unauthorised access, delayed incident response, or regulatory non-compliance, leading to reputational and financial damage.
threatDescription: Information security roles and responsibilities are unclear or not assigned, resulting in critical tasks being overlooked.

title: Introduction of vulnerabilities in new systems, resulting in potential data breaches or operational disruption.
description: Introduction of vulnerabilities in new systems, resulting in potential data breaches or operational disruption.
threatDescription: Security requirements are omitted or inadequately addressed during project planning or implementation.

title: Prolonged business interruption, data loss, or inability to meet contractual obligations.
description: Prolonged business interruption, data loss, or inability to meet contractual obligations.
threatDescription: ICT systems lack adequate redundancy, backup, or disaster recovery planning, failing during a disruptive event.

title: Regulatory fines, legal action, or loss of certifications, damaging business operations and reputation.
description: Regulatory fines, legal action, or loss of certifications, damaging business operations and reputation.
threatDescription: Changes in regulations or internal policies are not communicated or enforced, resulting in non-adherence.
mitigationDescription: We need to design a way for policy packs to be distributed on policy change, better version control for policies, and a mechanism for approval and confirmation of understanding. (See Risk #85, E I2-372)

title: Unauthorised disclosure of personal or confidential data, resulting in breaches and regulatory penalties.
description: Unauthorised disclosure of personal or confidential data, resulting in breaches and regulatory penalties.
threatDescription: Residual sensitive data remains accessible on retired or repurposed devices due to improper deletion methods.

title: Leakage of confidential or personal data, leading to privacy violations or reputational harm.
description: Leakage of confidential or personal data, leading to privacy violations or reputational harm.
threatDescription: Sensitive production data is used unmasked in non-production environments, exposing it to unauthorised personnel.

title: Data leakage causing reputational damage, customer loss, or legal consequences.
description: Data leakage causing reputational damage, customer loss, or legal consequences.
threatDescription: Confidential information is unintentionally or maliciously sent outside the organisation via insecure channels.
mitigationDescription: In addition to DLP we should take efforts to prevent use of external storage devices and provide better logging of access to sensitive materials. Risk #83 is a pre-requisite here and must first be resolved.

title: Prolonged attacker presence, increased damage, or untraceable incidents, undermining trust and compliance.
description: Prolonged attacker presence, increased damage, or untraceable incidents, undermining trust and compliance.
threatDescription: Security events go undetected due to insufficient monitoring or logging.
mitigationDescription: Our logging for our production hosted infrastructure is robust, however our logging for our administrative and clerical environments needs improvement as many activities on endpoints are not centrally logged. Risk #83 is a pre-requisite of addressing this.

title: Hindered forensic investigations, inability to prove compliance, or delayed incident response.
description: Hindered forensic investigations, inability to prove compliance, or delayed incident response.
threatDescription: Inconsistent or unsynchronised system clocks result in inaccurate event logs.
mitigationDescription: Our time management for our production hosted infrastructure is robust, however our time management for our administrative and clerical environments needs improvement as many endpoint clocks are not on enforced synchronisation. Risk #83 is a pre-requisite of addressing this.

title: System compromise, unauthorised changes, or data manipulation with severe operational or financial impact.
description: System compromise, unauthorised changes, or data manipulation with severe operational or financial impact.
threatDescription: Privileged utility programmes are misused by unauthorised users to bypass security controls.
mitigationDescription: When Risk #83 is resolved this will also be resolved as the treatment includes identifying and restricting access to privileged utility programmes.

title: Widespread compromise, data loss, or business disruption during a security incident.
description: Widespread compromise, data loss, or business disruption during a security incident.
threatDescription: Lack of network segmentation allows attackers or malware to move freely across systems.

title: Malware infections, phishing attacks, or data exfiltration, affecting system integrity and confidentiality.
description: Malware infections, phishing attacks, or data exfiltration, affecting system integrity and confidentiality.
threatDescription: Users access malicious or inappropriate websites due to insufficient web filtering.
mitigationDescription: Web filtering needs to be deployed and enforced centrally, current efforts are applying only low intelligence and small scale protections, but the protections and restrictions need to be more robust.

title: Increased susceptibility to sophisticated attacks, leading to breaches or prolonged compromise.
description: Increased susceptibility to sophisticated attacks, leading to breaches or prolonged compromise.
threatDescription: Systems are designed without considering layered security controls or secure engineering principles.

title: Exploitable weaknesses in applications, resulting in data breaches or service outages.
description: Exploitable weaknesses in applications, resulting in data breaches or service outages.
threatDescription: Developers introduce vulnerabilities through insecure coding practices (e.g., lack of input validation).

title: Undetected vulnerabilities exploited post-launch, causing data loss or operational disruption.
description: Undetected vulnerabilities exploited post-launch, causing data loss or operational disruption.
threatDescription: Security testing is skipped or insufficient before deployment of new or updated systems.

title: Compromised software supply chain, leading to breaches, data loss, or regulatory issues.
description: Compromised software supply chain, leading to breaches, data loss, or regulatory issues.
threatDescription: Outsourced developers introduce insecure code or backdoors due to lack of oversight or contractual controls.
mitigationDescription: We have no formal outsource development policies at the moment, though we do not currently outsource any of our development we should prepare for the eventuality to inform any potential business future planning. Implement automatic security scanning (DAST, SonarQube), manual code review (PR), and other build checks prior to accepting code from outsource developers and deployment to live environments. (E I2-468)

title: Accidental or intentional data corruption, leakage, or disruption of production services.
description: Accidental or intentional data corruption, leakage, or disruption of production services.
threatDescription: Development, test, and production environments are not separated, allowing unauthorised access to live data.

title: Non-conformances and risks could re-occur (potentially without notice) if assumed controls turn out to be ineffective.
description: Non-conformances and risks could re-occur (potentially without notice) if assumed controls turn out to be ineffective.
threatDescription: Non-conformance corrections and risk treatments could be ineffective (though assumed to be effective) because they are not reviewed.
mitigationDescription: Add a review process for Non-conformance corrections and risk treatments so that after a period of time from resolution they are reviewed to ensure they have remained effective. (E I2-478)

title: A member of staff could inadvertantly post something not intended for public release (yet), or an attacker could gain access and commit libel
description: A member of staff could inadvertantly post something not intended for public release (yet), or an attacker could gain access and commit libel
threatDescription: Publishing of incorrect/unapproved information to the corporate website
mitigationDescription: Implement modified cryptography process using modern, recommended, approaches. (A 10) (E I2-179)

title: Loss of data and exposure of sensitive data to attackers
description: Loss of data and exposure of sensitive data to attackers
threatDescription: Theft of office Network Attached Storage drive
mitigationDescription: Encrypt storage on the NAS (A 10.1) (E I2-113). Decommission planned for July 2020 (A.11.2.7 E I2-214).

title: Acceptacard may not be appropriately protecting card data which we are sending them. We may be therefore partially liable in the case of a breach of their systems.
description: Acceptacard may not be appropriately protecting card data which we are sending them. We may be therefore partially liable in the case of a breach of their systems.
threatDescription: Acceptacard haven't provided a valid PCI AOC
mitigationDescription: Encrypt storage on the NAS (A.10.1) (E I2-113). Review again next quarter, plan to decommission instead of encrypt.

title: Clarks of Amersham have no formal compliance with any data protection standard
threatDescription: Clarks of Amersham have no formal compliance with any data protection standard

title: Users receiving scam emails could supply credentials to an attacker or allow remote access/monitoring tooling to be installed on the network.
description: Users receiving scam emails could supply credentials to an attacker or allow remote access/monitoring tooling to be installed on the network.
threatDescription: Scam emails
mitigationDescription: Review again at next risk assessment audit. If incidence rate increases, or if they become more intelligent, which would affect likelihood we can look at implementing additional controls.

title: Moving to Sharepoint and Onedrive allows remote access to Paythru files. This was not previously possible.
description: Moving to Sharepoint and Onedrive allows remote access to Paythru files. This was not previously possible.
threatDescription: Remote access
mitigationDescription: Staff have moved to remote working.

title: Visitors who have been issued the code can re-access the building unsupervised and potentially take information or assets out with them.
description: Visitors who have been issued the code can re-access the building unsupervised and potentially take information or assets out with them.
threatDescription: Access code for visitors

title: We don't have sole control over our books. Hilltop Accounting could be accessing without our consent or control. We cannot revoke access in case of security breach.
description: We don't have sole control over our books. Hilltop Accounting could be accessing without our consent or control. We cannot revoke access in case of security breach.
threatDescription: The version of Quickbooks which we use is licenced to Hilltop Accounting
mitigationDescription: Aiming to move to our own licence in the new financial year (1st May 2019) (A 5.19) (E I2-135)

title: Minipark services not available, transactions failing, people stuck in car parks
description: Minipark services not available, transactions failing, people stuck in car parks
threatDescription: Minipark server over capacity
mitigationDescription: Move to new infrastructure with more expansion capacity (A 8.6) (E I2-136)

title: All services offline, no alternative hosting arrangements. We just have to wait for availability to be restored.
description: All services offline, no alternative hosting arrangements. We just have to wait for availability to be restored.
threatDescription: AWS complete Europe or worldwide failover
mitigationDescription: We could review multi-cloud solutions (Google, Microsoft). Or at least review options for deploying to those systems. Consider backup of code and data outside of AWS periodically.

title: Potential for loss of clients, investment support, complications with EU relationships. We don't know whether or not there is a risk, so find it difficult to prepare.
description: Potential for loss of clients, investment support, complications with EU relationships. We don't know whether or not there is a risk, so find it difficult to prepare.
threatDescription: Brexit

title: Heavy machinery impacting with the office building could cause damage, posing a risk to on-site staff and rendering the office unavailable to staff for a period of time.
description: Heavy machinery impacting with the office building could cause damage, posing a risk to on-site staff and rendering the office unavailable to staff for a period of time.
threatDescription: Risk of physical damage to property due to nearby demolition work being carried out

title: The increased footfall of workers due to the nearby demolition and construction work increases our overall exposure and visibility into the offices, thereby increasing potential for break-in.
description: The increased footfall of workers due to the nearby demolition and construction work increases our overall exposure and visibility into the offices, thereby increasing potential for break-in.
threatDescription: Increased risk of break-in due to nearby works
mitigationDescription: Landlord has been notified, request for additional insurance requested. Review of our own insurance cover. Photographs of building taken to ensure any damage is identifiable. Enforce laptops going home at the end of each day with staff for the duration of the work (currently best-efforts policy), reducing the impact of any loss of access to the building. (A.11.1 A.17.1) (E I2-137)

title: Our systems will no longer be competent for European based transaction processing (e.g. Brussels)
description: Our systems will no longer be competent for European based transaction processing (e.g. Brussels)
threatDescription: PSD2 UK interpretation of EBA open banking and SEPA based payment principles may diverge from what we've reviewed to-date
mitigationDescription: No new clients going to Acceptacard, existing clients to be migrated away (to Cashflows) within the next three months (A 8.6). (E I2-134)

title: Having to move clients to SCA compliant transaction processing by a deadline and not having time to achieve this could result in merchant transactions being declined en-masse
description: Having to move clients to SCA compliant transaction processing by a deadline and not having time to achieve this could result in merchant transactions being declined en-masse
threatDescription: PSD2 application of SCA ruling being enforced without us having conducted appropriate planning

title: Potential loss of V12 as a client, their contract is predicated on maintaining valid ISO 27001 compliance.
description: Potential loss of V12 as a client, their contract is predicated on maintaining valid ISO 27001 compliance.
threatDescription: Failure at ISO 27001 surveillance audit
mitigationDescription: 18-month window for implementation announce by FCA reduces this risk. Resource assigned as part of our priority planning to be pro-active on the subject. Agreed to work with Cashflows to be a Beta Partner on implementing SCA guidelines. (A 6.1.3) (E I2-141)

title: Difficulty performing some BAU functions, deployments, server updates. PCI compliance may be difficult or impossible to maintain without 2 PCI Key Custodians.
description: Difficulty performing some BAU functions, deployments, server updates. PCI compliance may be difficult or impossible to maintain without 2 PCI Key Custodians.
threatDescription: Key contractor (RT) terminates their contract with the organisation.
mitigationDescription: Plan to move to remote working with part-time office availability. (A 17.1.1) (E I2-140)

title: Rackspace may not be taking appropriate steps to ensure the Data they have access to is being protected. PCI re-certification may be difficult or impossible.
description: Rackspace may not be taking appropriate steps to ensure the Data they have access to is being protected. PCI re-certification may be difficult or impossible.
threatDescription: Rackspace PCI AOC has not been renewed for this year.
mitigationDescription: Enable MFA for all accounts (A 9.4.2) (E I2-125) (alongside email migration)

title: Card data is at increased risk because we are not using the modern, and recommended, approach to cryptography
description: Card data is at increased risk because we are not using the modern, and recommended, approach to cryptography
threatDescription: Cryptography process is out-of-date
mitigationDescription: Chase Rackspace for an up-to-date AOC. If that fails we'll server our service with them and look for alternatives. (A 18.2.2) (E I2-176)

title: The domain could expire, or be reconfigured at any time by FlowBird. Breaking the sites reliant on it and potentially allowing an attacker to commit MITM attacks if they takeover the expired domain.
description: The domain could expire, or be reconfigured at any time by FlowBird. Breaking the sites reliant on it and potentially allowing an attacker to commit MITM attacks if they takeover the expired domain.
threatDescription: Ticketlesspark domain is under the control of FlowBird, not Paythru
mitigationDescription: Risk not further controlled and instead accepted as it is. (A 17.1.1) (E I2-175). Accepted by risk owner.

title: Compliance issues could arise if we don't have all the necessary checks and balances in place. We could issues with day-to-day work whilst we move.
description: Compliance issues could arise if we don't have all the necessary checks and balances in place. We could issues with day-to-day work whilst we move.
threatDescription: Incomplete preparations for remote working when the lease on the office expires.
mitigationDescription: We'll arrange further meetings over the next few months to discuss technical issues related to remote working. CISO will investigate compliance issues (E I2-196).

title: Individuals could become less effective with their work, or discontented with the working situation (enough to look for a new job)
description: Individuals could become less effective with their work, or discontented with the working situation (enough to look for a new job)
threatDescription: Individuals not prepared, or not content, with remote working practices
mitigationDescription: We'll arrange further meetings over the next few months to discuss technical issues related to remote working. CISO will investigate compliance issues (E I2-196).

title: Failures in infrastructure could have a much larger impact than expected because failovers, or other recovery mechanisms, do not function as intentended.
description: Failures in infrastructure could have a much larger impact than expected because failovers, or other recovery mechanisms, do not function as intentended.
threatDescription: Some of our Business Continuity Procedures are not tested and auditable.
mitigationDescription: With the introduction of container-based applications, web nodes will be tested for failover every day. (A 17.1.3 E I2-195)

title: All, or the majority, of staff could fall ill at one-time. This would make it difficult for Paythru to continue to handle customer requests and progress projects.
description: All, or the majority, of staff could fall ill at one-time. This would make it difficult for Paythru to continue to handle customer requests and progress projects.
threatDescription: COVID-19 impact
mitigationDescription: Conduct a full review of the Business Continuity Plan and introduce specific procedures for more rigorously testing our technical failover and recovery responses (E I2-195 A 17.1.3)

title: Individuals may not be keeping their devices up-to-date including antivirus patches, and there is no central place to monitor this. This could lead to an attacker being able to gain access to a device.
description: Individuals may not be keeping their devices up-to-date including antivirus patches, and there is no central place to monitor this. This could lead to an attacker being able to gain access to a device.
threatDescription: Remote devices not being patched with relevant security patches
mitigationDescription: Investigate Microsoft Azure Active Directory tools and institute an audit procedure. Investigate centralised ESET reporting. (A 12.4.1 E I2-215)

title: Individuals may have an increased risk of devices or materials being stolen from their house or accessed remotely because the protections normally afforded by the office environment are no longer available.
description: Individuals may have an increased risk of devices or materials being stolen from their house or accessed remotely because the protections normally afforded by the office environment are no longer available.
threatDescription: Remote working has introduced the risk that in-house security is not up to the level previously available in office-based working

title: Devices in transit may go missing or may be stolen en-route
description: Devices in transit may go missing or may be stolen en-route
threatDescription: Shipping electronic devices to staff could expose them to the risk of theft or loss

title: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
description: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
threatDescription: Data transfer between UK and EU clients being interrupted due to non-compliance with new regulations when they come into force.

title: Loss or theft of sensitive company data could lead to compliance or contractual issues, or malicious actors gaining access to sensitive company data.
description: Loss or theft of sensitive company data could lead to compliance or contractual issues, or malicious actors gaining access to sensitive company data.
threatDescription: Documentation stored at JR Chesham and Clarks of Amersham could be lost or stolen.
mitigationDescription: Remove all superfluous or uneeded documentation. Digitise all company sensitive data which must be retained and destroy physical copies. Accounting records for 3 years will be retained in MD's own lockable storage.

title: The attacker, with access to the account, could access any email or documents available to that individual to create/copy/modify/delete.
description: The attacker, with access to the account, could access any email or documents available to that individual to create/copy/modify/delete.
threatDescription: Malicious access to Office 365 account using known password, bypassing MFA or while MFA is disabled.

title: If computers or sensitive materials are left behind in the office they could be picked up by building staff or other building users in our absence and copied/used.
description: If computers or sensitive materials are left behind in the office they could be picked up by building staff or other building users in our absence and copied/used.
threatDescription: Serviced office location - staff could leave sensitive materials or computing devices behind.

title: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
description: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
threatDescription: Closed society/territorial support. Global roll-out to those locations which require data sovereignty.
mitigationDescription: Review the available AWS regions and therefore territories we could deploy infrastructure to without technical compliance concerns (allowing for changes required by local regulations).

title: AWS accounts can be breached either via API credentials or console login. A breach could constitute a risk for access to sensitive data, data manipulation, business disruption and additional cost for services used on our account by an attacker.
description: AWS accounts can be breached either via API credentials or console login. A breach could constitute a risk for access to sensitive data, data manipulation, business disruption and additional cost for services used on our account by an attacker.
threatDescription: Breach of AWS accounts.
mitigationDescription: Review the AWS Guard Duty product for suitability (the product watches AWS account activity and usage and can alert on actions considered suspicious). Review AWS accounts to ensure only necessary accounts are active and that active accounts have the minimum access necessary to fulfil their function. Setup a periodic review of this to ensure it remains the case in future. (A 5.27, 12.4.1, 9.2.5 E I2-302)

title: Renewal could be jeopardised if we cannot reach an agreement with the reseller. The supplier themselves have not been formally added to our supplier register.
description: Renewal could be jeopardised if we cannot reach an agreement with the reseller. The supplier themselves have not been formally added to our supplier register.
threatDescription: There is a reseller intermediary for ESET AV software.

title: We're implementing a new CRM system and we run the risk of not implementing a security review during client/project onboarding. There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
description: We're implementing a new CRM system and we run the risk of not implementing a security review during client/project onboarding. There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
threatDescription: Pipedrive - include security review as part of onboarding process.
mitigationDescription: Review Pipedrive tooling to see if a security review can be injected into the onboarding process. (A 6.1.5 E I2-304)

title: Risk Pipedrive is no longer being used. This risk can be closed.,3,3,2,8,1,8,Y,Retain,A.8.26

Our Mac estate (two-devices) is not currently included in our ESET Antivirus licensing and therefore the devices do not have specific antivirus protections. The potential impact of viruses is well documented.
description: Our Mac estate (two-devices) is not currently included in our ESET Antivirus licensing and therefore the devices do not have specific antivirus protections. The potential impact of viruses is well documented.
threatDescription: ESET AV for Mac

title: Storage devices are not now being properly cleared when they are no longer used, if the affected devices are lost or stolen they would still contain sensitive company data.
description: Storage devices are not now being properly cleared when they are no longer used, if the affected devices are lost or stolen they would still contain sensitive company data.
threatDescription: Laptops and other devices are staying at individual employee homes at the end of their useful lifetime.

title: Risk to ability to our direct supply chain to provide their contracted services, effect of inflation of currencies etc.
description: Risk to ability to our direct supply chain to provide their contracted services, effect of inflation of currencies etc.
threatDescription: Conflict in Ukraine and general instability in global markets.

title: Risk May affect our ability to raise money

Risk of compromised communication components being used in infrastructure we're using, apropos the UK Governments' decision not to grant contracts to companies from China/Russia related to our Critical National Infrastructure (Nuclear, 5G) which is also having an impact on other markets (such as EV Charging Infrastructure).
description: Risk of compromised communication components being used in infrastructure we're using, apropos the UK Governments' decision not to grant contracts to companies from China/Russia related to our Critical National Infrastructure (Nuclear, 5G) which is also having an impact on other markets (such as EV Charging Infrastructure).
threatDescription: Communication components security.

title: Risk AWS and Microsoft are not expected to be at risk. Homes might be a problem.,We already have a subscription with Regus which allows staff to use their lounge areas at any location
Risk We do not anticipate any disruption to service even if power outages are planned. Only administrative functions would be affected.,1,1,3,5,2,10,Retain,,,,,,,,,,A.8.14

Risk Strength of the  shouldn't have too great an impact as our trading is currently mostly internal to the UK. Foreign currency trading is a small part of our income and will remain as such for a while to come.,Paythru does not hold any debt and so interest rates do not directly affect our business and the tertiary affect can be monitored and managed accordingly.,1,1,2,4,2,8,Retain,,,,,,,,,,A.5.29
Charge point manufacturers having a hard time sourcing components. No expected impact on us, but we're monitoring the situation.
description: Charge point manufacturers having a hard time sourcing components. No expected impact on us, but we're monitoring the situation.
threatDescription: Supply chain issues

title: Pending the significant growth in the business we feel it's time to change our reporting and responsibilities for both the risk assessment and other components of the ISMS. This will be monitored both as a business change and a risk.
description: Pending the significant growth in the business we feel it's time to change our reporting and responsibilities for both the risk assessment and other components of the ISMS. This will be monitored both as a business change and a risk.
threatDescription: Risk assessment process.

title: Risk If we continue with our current risk assessment processes despite the business expansion and strategic changes we run a real risk of missing or misidentifying potential risks and not planning appropriately for them.,Current risk assessments include the company MD

If a new member of staff doesn't follow the established data protection standards and protections, they could do something like export personal data to an insecure location and share this to places it should not be shared.
description: If a new member of staff doesn't follow the established data protection standards and protections, they could do something like export personal data to an insecure location and share this to places it should not be shared.
threatDescription: New staff adhering to data protection standards.

title: Risk Senior members of staff might be able to assert authority to bypass security protections and this would be wrong and should be prevented.
Risk This risk is exacerbated by the presence of new staff.,The technical team have processes for managing this

Risk Data requests (for Paythru to provide data to customers/clients/partners) should be only made via formal ticket. A second signature should be required for any out-of-band data requests (typical route would be to allow a client to export their own data with their own existing platform access

If we do not maintain a view of the Data Protection requirements from the ICO we may be liable to pay substantial fines or get into legal issues. This may seriously affect our ability to continue to conduct business.
description: If we do not maintain a view of the Data Protection requirements from the ICO we may be liable to pay substantial fines or get into legal issues. This may seriously affect our ability to continue to conduct business.
threatDescription: Paythru not complying with any requirements from the ICO, including appropriate registration as a Data Controller.

title: Risk Our Data Controller registration auto-renews and is reviewed each year when renewal confirmation is received to ensure it is the appropriate registration level.,1,2,4,7,1,7,Retain,,,,,,,,,,A.5.31
Paythru staff may, if unaware of the rules or repercussions, conduct practices in contravention with the Computer Misuse Act 1990 which would lead to fines and potential imprisonment.
description: Paythru staff may, if unaware of the rules or repercussions, conduct practices in contravention with the Computer Misuse Act 1990 which would lead to fines and potential imprisonment.
threatDescription: Paythru not complying with the Computer Misuse Act.

title: Non-compliance with the regulation may result in fines or legal repercussions.
description: Non-compliance with the regulation may result in fines or legal repercussions.
threatDescription: New Data Protection and Digital Information (No. 2) Bill, risk of the impact of new legislation requirements. https://bills.parliament.uk/bills/3430
mitigationDescription: Seek professional counsel on implementing GDPR compliance services in Europe.

title: Increased risk of phishing and spear-phishing as we grow and become a more interesting target to attackers.
threatDescription: Increased risk of phishing and spear-phishing as we grow and become a more interesting target to attackers.

title: If a malicious actor replaces the QR codes (physically) and directs customers to a nefarious website - an attacker could start collecting cardholder data and personal data from consumers.
description: If a malicious actor replaces the QR codes (physically) and directs customers to a nefarious website - an attacker could start collecting cardholder data and personal data from consumers.
threatDescription: QR code tampering on charge points.
mitigationDescription: Research mitigations. Text to a shortcode.

title: Static risk of a member of staff extracting application code and leaving the company with it.
description: Static risk of a member of staff extracting application code and leaving the company with it.
threatDescription: Staff are allowed access to sensitive company data, including application code as necessary to fulfil their job function.

title: Business agreements or arrangements made in this way cannot be properly monitored or traced, potentially bypassing proper procedure, limiting the internal audience visibility and affecting our ability to assess C.I.A. as part of business engagements.
description: Business agreements or arrangements made in this way cannot be properly monitored or traced, potentially bypassing proper procedure, limiting the internal audience visibility and affecting our ability to assess C.I.A. as part of business engagements.
threatDescription: Material business conducted via social media and/or on personal mobile phones.
mitigationDescription: Create new Company policies for the use of social media (especially WhatsApp).

title: Risk Formally issue Company phones to allow them to be more readily controlled and monitored centrally. (E I2-320 I2-321 A 6.2),3,4,1,8,1,8,Y,Retain,A.5.1

Personnel, especially upon leaving the Company, may not necessarily declare their status with Paythru and as a result may continue to be perceived to represent us when that is patently not true, or simply not appropriate.
description: Personnel, especially upon leaving the Company, may not necessarily declare their status with Paythru and as a result may continue to be perceived to represent us when that is patently not true, or simply not appropriate.
threatDescription: Staff, who are in regular contact with external parties, issuing their own personal mobile number as a contact form.
mitigationDescription: We're embarking on a process to more tightly control phones and to issue Company phones to all senior staff, or staff otherwise likely to engage in external conversations. (E I2-320 A 6.2)

title: Risk of missing something on internal IT as we grow, such as maintenance of AV licenses, proper configuration of Office 365 estate, and appropriate end-user device limitations.
description: Risk of missing something on internal IT as we grow, such as maintenance of AV licenses, proper configuration of Office 365 estate, and appropriate end-user device limitations.
threatDescription: Internal IT is being managed by a single individual (CISO), and not by a dedicated or trained team.
mitigationDescription: Utilize (E I2-322 A 5.7)

title: Risk of impersonation or confusion in staff dealing with the new Internal IT Support company, either by impersonation or the IT Support company not being familiar with our secure practices.
description: Risk of impersonation or confusion in staff dealing with the new Internal IT Support company, either by impersonation or the IT Support company not being familiar with our secure practices.
threatDescription: Creating a relationship with a new Internal IT support company (Utilize), granting them access to our systems and those of our staff.
mitigationDescription: Utilize (E I2-322 A 6.3)

title: Paythru could become the subject of substantial settlement claims or appeal cases if this subject is not correctly handled.
description: Paythru could become the subject of substantial settlement claims or appeal cases if this subject is not correctly handled.
threatDescription: Work related stress is now part of Health and Safety, enforced by the HSE, so it moves from Civil Law to Criminal Law.
mitigationDescription: Increase the cover provided by Croner.

title: If we do not prepare early enough for deployment in the US we may not be ready in time for the first rollout and this could lead to breaches of local regulations and compliance, fines, and ISMS scope.
description: If we do not prepare early enough for deployment in the US we may not be ready in time for the first rollout and this could lead to breaches of local regulations and compliance, fines, and ISMS scope.
threatDescription: Deploying our infrastructure and applications to the US without proper planning and preparation resulting in breach of compliance and regulation, and not including the US deployment fully in our ISMS.
mitigationDescription: Seek external consultancy (e.g. PaymentGenes) to get local expertise prior to rollout.

title: Access to Paythru Sensitive, Paythru Confidential, and Paythru Proprietary information.
description: Access to Paythru Sensitive, Paythru Confidential, and Paythru Proprietary information.
threatDescription: Loss or theft of a company issued laptop or company issued mobile phone.
mitigationDescription: Users are supplied with guidance, policies, and training on how to correctly handle and protect their issued hardware.

title: Risk Additional backup implemented on SharePoint/OneDrive. Insurance upgraded to cover financial losses.
Deep fakes or impersonation could be used to request malicious transfer of funds or company sensitive information, breaching confidentiality, or causing financial concerns.
description: Deep fakes or impersonation could be used to request malicious transfer of funds or company sensitive information, breaching confidentiality, or causing financial concerns.
threatDescription: Artificial Intelligence: risk of impersonation and deep fakes
mitigationDescription: Provide regular additional training to key personnel (especially those with access to company funds and sensitive company information) on the risks of impersonation and deep fakes. Investigate potential additional processes and checks to further mitigate. (E I2-375).

title: Documentation and other company information currently stored in SharePoint is not necessarily correctly labelled and restricted to internal Paythru staff. Currently some access is restricted largely by how difficult it is to find the documents, with Artificial Intelligence search and information discovery becomes powerful enough that previously undiscovered content may surface in search results even though we'd prefer the user did not have access to the information.
description: Documentation and other company information currently stored in SharePoint is not necessarily correctly labelled and restricted to internal Paythru staff. Currently some access is restricted largely by how difficult it is to find the documents, with Artificial Intelligence search and information discovery becomes powerful enough that previously undiscovered content may surface in search results even though we'd prefer the user did not have access to the information.
threatDescription: Artificial Intelligence: content discovery
mitigationDescription: The current SharePoint organisation process should be monitored, the risk score assumes satisfactory completion of that exercise.

title: Users may inadvertently cause problems with using their laptops, requiring support to resolve issues.
description: Users may inadvertently cause problems with using their laptops, requiring support to resolve issues.
threatDescription: All Paythru staff have Local Administrator accounts on their laptops. They may use this privilege to install software, disable system protections, or change sensitive system configurations.

title: Risk They may install malicious software (accidentally or intentionally) which could lead to a breach in security for that device and allow an attacker access to everything that device or user has access to.
Risk They may disable protections such as antivirus or drive encryption
assetCategory: and disk encryption all configured and set to acceptable default levels. The user would need to proactively disable any of these elements and through both training and policy we discourage any such action.

title: Risk Staff also have access to only the information needed to complete their job function

Paythru Sensitive, Confidential, or Proprietary information could be leaked to unauthorised people (internal or external to the organisation) and information within could cause financial or reputational harm, or otherwise reduce the effectiveness of controls and undermind our security. If staff do not correctly apply classification labels, or misinterpret their meaning they could inadvertently grant access where it should not be granted, or share to a wider audience than intended.
description: Paythru Sensitive, Confidential, or Proprietary information could be leaked to unauthorised people (internal or external to the organisation) and information within could cause financial or reputational harm, or otherwise reduce the effectiveness of controls and undermind our security. If staff do not correctly apply classification labels, or misinterpret their meaning they could inadvertently grant access where it should not be granted, or share to a wider audience than intended.
threatDescription: Staff not correctly applying information classification labels. Staff may incorrectly apply classification labels, omit to apply classification labels, or misinterpret applied classification labels.
mitigationDescription: The likelihood of misclassification is too high, and some documents are seen to have classifications which mismatch between the metadata and the content of the document. We need to engage in a more regular pattern of awareness training on this topic to ensure the rules are adhered to and the classifications properly understood.

title: Risk Review file access and sharing on a periodic basis.
Staff may accidentally edit or delete important policy documentation leading to incorrect procedures being followed or may maliciously alter documentation.
description: Staff may accidentally edit or delete important policy documentation leading to incorrect procedures being followed or may maliciously alter documentation.
threatDescription: Some ISMS documentation is only available in raw form (i.e. Microsoft Word/Excel) and can be edited by all staff.
mitigationDescription: Produce documentation as non editable PDFs and restrict editing to necessary personnel on all platforms. Control link to be created. (E I2-372)

title: Malicious payout of large sums of money.
description: Malicious payout of large sums of money.
threatDescription: Payout from the company bank account only requires single signature to action

title: Risk Devices are enrolled in Microsoft Intune and can be remotely wiped if this is necessary.,4,2,2,8,1,8,Retain,,,,,,,,,,A.5.11
Risk Windows logs (for administrative laptops and devices used by our staff for day-to-day operations) can log centrally to a Microsoft service

If access to critical systems is not effectively controlled, outsourced developers or internal users may retain or gain more privileges than necessary, potentially accessing or altering sensitive information or system configurations beyond their remit, even after their engagement ends. This could result in data compromise, service disruption, or regulatory non-compliance.
description: If access to critical systems is not effectively controlled, outsourced developers or internal users may retain or gain more privileges than necessary, potentially accessing or altering sensitive information or system configurations beyond their remit, even after their engagement ends. This could result in data compromise, service disruption, or regulatory non-compliance.
threatDescription: Failure to enforce access restrictions and timely removal of permissions

title: Code or secrets leaked leading to compromise of production environment
description: Code or secrets leaked leading to compromise of production environment
threatDescription: External developers mishandling source code or credentials

title: Inadequate monitoring of third-party access could allow outsourced developers to bypass security processes or misuse repositories, leading to source code exposure or leakage of credentials and internal documentation.
description: Inadequate monitoring of third-party access could allow outsourced developers to bypass security processes or misuse repositories, leading to source code exposure or leakage of credentials and internal documentation.
threatDescription: Poorly controlled third-party access or weak contractor oversight

title: Failure to ensure that outsourced developers adhere to Paythrus PCI DSS and GDPR obligations could result in non-compliance penalties, data breaches, or reputational damage.
description: Failure to ensure that outsourced developers adhere to Paythrus PCI DSS and GDPR obligations could result in non-compliance penalties, data breaches, or reputational damage.
threatDescription: Non-compliance with regulatory standards and data protection laws

title: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
description: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
threatDescription: Data transfer between UK and EU clients being interrupted due to non-compliance with new regulations when they come into force.

title: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
description: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
threatDescription: Closed society/territorial support. Global roll-out to those locations which require data sovereignty.
mitigationDescription: Review the available AWS regions and therefore territories we could deploy infrastructure to without technical compliance concerns (allowing for changes required by local regulations).

title: We're implementing a new CRM system and we run the risk of not implementing a security review during client/project onboarding. There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
description: We're implementing a new CRM system and we run the risk of not implementing a security review during client/project onboarding. There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
threatDescription: Pipedrive - include security review as part of onboarding process.
mitigationDescription: Review Pipedrive tooling to see if a security review can be injected into the onboarding process. (A 6.1.5 E I2-304)

title: Apple iOS Artificial Intelligence being launched.
threatDescription: Apple iOS Artificial Intelligence being launched.

title: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
description: We may be forced to halt business until remedial action is taken. Risk of fines for breach of regulation.
threatDescription: Data transfer between UK and EU clients being interrupted due to non-compliance with new regulations when they come into force.

title: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
description: When looking at our more global roll-out we're going to meet various compliance issues and new risks due to different local regulations. Data sovereignty (when a nation does not allow Personal Data to leave their own defined boundary) is one major operational risk, and compliance with it is both difficult and critical.
threatDescription: Closed society/territorial support. Global roll-out to those locations which require data sovereignty.
mitigationDescription: Review the available AWS regions and therefore territories we could deploy infrastructure to without technical compliance concerns (allowing for changes required by local regulations).
