There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
description: We're implementing a new CRM system and we run the risk of not implementing a security review during client/project onboarding. There are a number of new staff who will need to learn this so incorporating it as part of the process greatly reduces the chances of the step being missed. If the security review is missed then we could implement something dangerous (in terms of regulatory compliance) or have to back out of an agreed contract late (and therefore negatively impacting our image).
threatDescription: Pipedrive - include security review as part of onboarding process.
mitigationDescription: Review Pipedrive tooling to see if a security review can be injected into the onboarding process. (A 6.1.5 E I2-304)

title: No major impact on electricity price changes. But the announced planned power outages from the government will need contingency plans.
description: No major impact on electricity price changes. But the announced planned power outages from the government will need contingency plans.
threatDescription: Impact of electricity supply and price.

title: Utilize only has one authorised contact (currently Paythru's CISO) for approving
threatDescription: Utilize only has one authorised contact (currently Paythru's CISO) for approving
mitigationDescription: Request that Utilize email for all authorisation requests, even if they require a phone call (so for phone call authorisations they also email) so there is a full audit trail of the request.

title: Widespread compromise, data loss, or business disruption during a security incident.
description: Widespread compromise, data loss, or business disruption during a security incident.
threatDescription: Lack of network segmentation allows attackers or malware to move freely across systems.

title: Undetected vulnerabilities exploited post-launch, causing data loss or operational disruption.
description: Undetected vulnerabilities exploited post-launch, causing data loss or operational disruption.
threatDescription: Security testing is skipped or insufficient before deployment of new or updated systems.

title: A member of staff accidentally installs malware on their machine
description: An attacker could gain access to sensitive company data and proprietary information
threatDescription: The malware could grant access to an attacker

title: Access to information, issue for personnel to no longer be able to get home
description: Access to information, issue for personnel to no longer be able to get home
threatDescription: Loss of equipment (phone/Laptop) most likely to occur in London whilst travelling solo
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Encrypted  more of a risk to personnel (not being able to get home

Potential Additional Controls: Do not travel with the Laptop unless specifically necessary, and carry a physical credit card separately from the laptop and phone.

title: Long journeys and solo travelling might result in poor decisions and lack of judgement
description: Long journeys and solo travelling might result in poor decisions and lack of judgement
threatDescription: Injury whilst travelling
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Take favourable journeys rather than rushed options. Choose meetings at reasonable times. Ensure a control on the diary to avoid too much fatigue. Opt for the train instead of driving. Adhere to the driver handbook.

Potential Additional Controls: Let people know where I am/when I am leaving/when I arrive and update the calendar as accurately as possible to include travel time.

title: Solo business representation at events where alcohol and late evening activities are planned
description: Solo business representation at events where alcohol and late evening activities are planned
threatDescription: Unwanted physical approach at events
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Limit opportunity and adhere to the sexual misconduct guidance in the staff handbook

Potential Additional Controls: Let people know where I am/when I am leaving/when I arrive and update the calendar as accurately as possible to include travel time. Report any unwanted advances to HR and line manager

title: Misrepresentation of Paythru at events on stage. Give away IP of Paythrus business plan
description: Misrepresentation of Paythru at events on stage. Give away IP of Paythrus business plan
threatDescription: Inaccurate information given at public event
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Use corporate presentation decks. Take the time to review the intended content with MD and CMO. Adjust presentation on the day according to the audience

Potential Additional Controls: Do not circulate the presentation. Report to CISO and MD/CMO if anything occurred to make this a reality.

title: Robustness and reliance on Quickbooks
description: Robustness and reliance on Quickbooks
threatDescription: Accounting systems and platform
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Multiple sign on to Quickbooks

title: Reliance on one member of staff who is retired and part time
description: Reliance on one member of staff who is retired and part time
threatDescription: Key personnel
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Back up support available from RPGC

Potential Additional Controls: Recruitment process post funding

title: On-going financial losses, delays to the investment process and a net liability balance sheet constrain new business opportunities
description: On-going financial losses, delays to the investment process and a net liability balance sheet constrain new business opportunities
threatDescription: Funding and capital adequacy
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Investment process with Infinium Partners is on-going

Potential Additional Controls: Evaluation and forecasting models are regularly reviewed Existing shareholder support

title: Sales and new business volumes fall short of budget/forecast impacting margin, profitability, liquidity and capital
description: Sales and new business volumes fall short of budget/forecast impacting margin, profitability, liquidity and capital
threatDescription: Revenue and profitability
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Sales leads are actively pursued and monitored

Potential Additional Controls: Existing contracts and clients are carefully managed

title: Outstanding liabilities to HMRC for PAYE, NIC and VAT
description: Outstanding liabilities to HMRC for PAYE, NIC and VAT
threatDescription: HMRC and other legislative bodies
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Arrangements to pay are in place and regularly updated in correspondence with HMRC

title: Economic conditions "worsen" putting pressure on commercial/financial margins, performance and profitability. Slow growth in the EV market
description: Economic conditions "worsen" putting pressure on commercial/financial margins, performance and profitability. Slow growth in the EV market
threatDescription: Economic risks
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Economic conditions and market growth assumptions are regularly reviewed and incorporated into all evaluation and forecasting models

title: Risk that poor communication may lead to performance issues or staff turnover
description: Risk that poor communication may lead to performance issues or staff turnover
threatDescription: Communication risk
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Exec team are regularly updated and filter to their teams; there is a regular Staff Newsletter

title: Low productivity that may be due to factors beyond a staff members control such as project delays
description: Low productivity that may be due to factors beyond a staff members control such as project delays
threatDescription: Productivity risk
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: As previous comments

title: The risk that employees/ the team may not be as productive due to blurred work-life boundaries, distractions that make it difficult to focus, loneliness leading to poor mental health, communication and Teams fatigue
description: The risk that employees/ the team may not be as productive due to blurred work-life boundaries, distractions that make it difficult to focus, loneliness leading to poor mental health, communication and Teams fatigue
threatDescription: Continued WFH risk
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Regular check-ins with workers at home, and increased encouragement, when applicable to have face-to-face meetings, attend events and get out more

title: Knowledge gap from their accumulation of client & process knowledge.
description: Knowledge gap from their accumulation of client & process knowledge.
threatDescription: The loss of Head of Operations either from long term sickness or leaving.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Some knowledge exists with the CSM but skill set means incumbent CSM is not part of existing succession plan.

Potential Additional Controls: Look to recruit future deputy and train up or widen out internal skill base within the business.

title: Ability to recruit in time and the notice period of any key personnel could mean we have a short / medium term knowledge gap in the business
description: Ability to recruit in time and the notice period of any key personnel could mean we have a short / medium term knowledge gap in the business
threatDescription: No succession planning in place for Operational Team
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Whilst no formal controls are in place knowledge is spread between numerous internal parties including admin, tech, product and ops.

Potential Additional Controls: Consider what high risk duties key personnel do and endeavour to create a back up plan to mitigate any risks.

title: CSM not aware or cognicsent of all billable product features and as a result misses fee earning opportunities.  Or fails to chase clients in a timely manner.
description: CSM not aware or cognicsent of all billable product features and as a result misses fee earning opportunities.  Or fails to chase clients in a timely manner.
threatDescription: Incorrect invoicing or account billing or missing invoicing opportunities.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Real and present risk with incumbent CSM whereby the TSM or the Directors Executive either corrects or reminds CSM to invoice correctly or to bill clients.

Potential Additional Controls: Move this key function out of this role or recruit replacement.

title: TSM / DE have accumulated long term knowledge of the business and their loss could open us up to gaps in our day to day duties or customer knowledge
description: TSM / DE have accumulated long term knowledge of the business and their loss could open us up to gaps in our day to day duties or customer knowledge
threatDescription: Lack of Cross Departmental Training / Knowledge  (Transfer of Knowledge)
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Look to up skill key members of the business so these gaps are mitigated.

Potential Additional Controls: Skill / Knowledge gap analysis then put in place training plans.

title: Using customer service tools and making changes to products/ services which could adversely impact both financial / reputation of the business
description: Using customer service tools and making changes to products/ services which could adversely impact both financial / reputation of the business
threatDescription: Incorrect use of Broomstick.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Basic training is in place.  Ensure key features which could be harmful to our clients our returns are locked out and are only available as view only.

Potential Additional Controls: Ensure training on all key areas to all non technical team members.

title: Not being aware products or services or pricing has changed and presenting the incorrect fees to a customer.
description: Not being aware products or services or pricing has changed and presenting the incorrect fees to a customer.
threatDescription: Presenting incorrect financial data to a client.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: We should only have one place to find all key financial information this should be on sharepoint

Potential Additional Controls: Review all accounts past and present and ensure all Ts & Cs are in place all financial documents can be found and are stored correctly.

title: All non technical personnel understand the importance of our ISO Audits and their potential involvement
description: All non technical personnel understand the importance of our ISO Audits and their potential involvement
threatDescription: ISO Audits
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: CISO has control over auditor conversations but not who they choose.   Cascade information of audit should be prescriptive with all team members knowing their potential duties.

Potential Additional Controls: Future training in advancement of audits that you might be called upon.

title: Over-reliance on CISO.
description: Overly reliance on CISO.
threatDescription: PCI Audit
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Annual PCI Audit requires CTO / CISO to step out the business to perform this annual task.  No succession plan in place.

title: Mitigate the reliance of contractors in critical roles.
description: Mitigate the reliance of contractors in critical roles.
threatDescription: Contractor Roles ( Critical )
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Upskill existing team members or recruit FTE with a view to replace should need be required

title: Lack of cross departmental use & knowledge in JIRA and Atlassian could lead to comms gaps
description: Lack of cross departmental use & knowledge in JIRA and Atlassian could lead to comms gaps
threatDescription: Low fluency in key roles and the ability to use JIRA Atlassian to a good level.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Still remains a low fluency in Atlassian and Jira between Ops and Product teams which does not aid commercial & engineering fluency

Potential Additional Controls: Support with enhanced training

title: Multiple locations to update client / customer contact
description: Multiple locations to update client / customer contact
threatDescription: Discipline on file notes customer information .
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Sharepoint; Jira & Monday all store different sources of information.

Potential Additional Controls: Investment in building and training people to use one customer portal [Sharepoint / Jira  etc ]

title: Reliant on MD on transactional payment pricing and the generation of margin through payment
description: Reliant on MD on transactional payment pricing and the generation of margin through payment
threatDescription: Fundamental Payment knowledge on pricing and compliance.
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Succession planning required but the use of the Adyen Marketplace Platform will mitigate some of these problems

title: Lack of engineering and product resources to research, design and deliver to market at pace.   Or keep up with the pace of change.
description: Lack of engineering and product resources to research, design and deliver to market at pace.   Or keep up with the pace of change.
threatDescription: Not being able to deliver embedded finance products at pace to our chosen markets.
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: We are reliant on a small team of engineers & product specialists where we have to design, build and maintain products.

title: Should we want to be a consumer card issuer.  Greater demands on legal requirements.
description: Should we want to be a consumer card issuer.  Greater demands on legal requirements.
threatDescription: Consumer Driven Products (Cards) Legal Complexities.
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: We have limited internal experience of running a consumer card proposition with the existing legal requirements.  Recruitment and will be a requirement.

title: Lack of experience in running an independent PM Office which reports to the executive team.
description: Lack of experience in running an independent PM Office which reports to the executive team.
threatDescription: Lack of capability or capacity to run a Program Office or to manage multiple change streams all at once.
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Demonstrating we are in control of any significant change programs will require some investment in a PO / PM to independently report to the Exec Board and Investors.

title: 6 monthly review of those in such roles and likelihood to meet succession plans & / or are they a threat to the business by leaving.  Should span all areas.
description: 6 monthly review of those in such roles and likelihood to meet succession plans & / or are they a threat to the business by leaving.  Should span all areas.
threatDescription: Retention of talent or ensuring those in critical roles are retained or are part of a wider succession plan.  ( Succession Planning / Retention )
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Retention plans are co-ordinated with a clear roadmap to support teams to retain their staff.

title: Transparent risk assessment as to the state of each customer.  Ie Growth / Dormant / Transitioning.
description: Transparent risk assessment as to the state of each customer.  Ie Growth / Dormant / Transitioning.
threatDescription: Regular engagement to manage changes in client behaviour and their business
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: Regular meetings F2F and virtual to continually assess state of clients.

title: Over reliance on 1 or 2 key people in each business and we dont always have  multiple touch points with key organisations.
description: Over reliance on 1 or 2 key people in each business and we dont always have  multiple touch points with key organisations.
threatDescription: Over reliance on customer administrators as our core contacts.
mitigationDescription: Existing Controls: We continue to educate and guide our clients in the need to have regular meetings and client reviews.

title: Small EV based accounts are labour intensive to service and are not yielding positive returns
description: Small EV based accounts are labour intensive to service and are not yielding positive returns
threatDescription: Low value accounts take up high volumes of administrative time and the returns for growth or profit are low.
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Building bespoke products which can not be reused are timely & expensive and require regular maintenance to manage.  This requires continual engineering support and investment which outweighs the original payment and ongoing earnings.

Potential Additional Controls: Objective assessment over our complete operating model with our future state in mind. Are we be missing out on new opportunities either due to structure, new emerging products, people or engineering resources.  Would an independent review give us a framework for change? 3 3 9

title: Failing to comply with data protection regulations like GDPR, CCPA, or similar regional laws could result in legal penalties.
description: Failing to comply with data protection regulations like GDPR, CCPA, or similar regional laws could result in legal penalties.
threatDescription: Violation of data privacy laws
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Data protection policies, regular compliance audits, employee training.

Potential Additional Controls: Limit the collection and retention of personal data to what is strictly necessary for business purposes. Develop and maintain a robust data breach response plan to ensure quick containment, investigation, and reporting of breaches.

title: Unfavorable reports or criticism in traditional media outlets, such as tarde mags or online news platforms.
description: Unfavorable reports or criticism in traditional media outlets, such as tarde mags or online news platforms.
threatDescription: Negative coverage
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Media monitoring.

Potential Additional Controls: Establish a crisis communication plan, and train spokespersons to mitigate and manage risks.

title: Reputational damage or legal action if marketing materials contain inaccurate or misleading information.
description: Reputational damage or legal action if marketing materials contain inaccurate or misleading information.
threatDescription: Misinformation or misleading claims
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Internal approval process to prevent misinformation or misleading claims in marketing materials.

Potential Additional Controls: Engage legal counsel to review marketing materials for compliance with local advertising laws and regulations  particularly as we enter the US market.

title: Negative reactions or criticism on social media platforms due to controversial actions, statements, or unforeseen events.
description: Negative reactions or criticism on social media platforms due to controversial actions, statements, or unforeseen events.
threatDescription: Social media backlash
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Internal approval process for social media posts, ensuring alignment with brand values and audience expectations.

Potential Additional Controls: Use social media monitoring tools to track sentiment, identify potential issues early, and respond proactively. Provide training on inclusivity and cultural sensitivity to avoid unintentionally offensive content.

title: Unauthorised access to sensitive marketing data, including customer information, campaign strategies, or analytics.
description: Unauthorised access to sensitive marketing data, including customer information, campaign strategies, or analytics.
threatDescription: Unauthorised access to marketing data
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Regular audits to detect unusual activity, identify potential security breaches, and ensure compliance with access policies.

Potential Additional Controls: Have a well-defined incident response plan in place to quickly address any breaches, including notification procedures and remedial actions.

title: Insufficient resource in already small team
description: Insufficient resource in already small team
threatDescription: Long term absence from work of departmental staff
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Progress of project work is discussed at standup meetings each morning with the Operations Team, the members of which could potentially step in to help out.

Potential Additional Controls: Identity a suitable temporary recruitment agency with suitable candidates.

title: Effort wasted by technical team
description: Effort wasted by technical team
threatDescription: Poorly specified product definitions
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Specification documentation are written for all major projects.

Potential Additional Controls: Document could perhaps require approval to ensure no ambiguity.

title: Poor quality products or user experience
description: Poor quality products or user experience
threatDescription: Single-minded decision making
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: The design of important features and products are disussed between the members of the product team.

Potential Additional Controls: A design council could be introduced to widen the range of opinions to ensure optimal product designs.

title: Poor quality or inoperable products
description: Poor quality or inoperable products
threatDescription: Inadequate testing
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: Testing currently conducted by product owner

Potential Additional Controls: Testing could perhaps be conducted by staff unfamiliar with the product for unbiased opinion

title: Products uncompetitive in the market
description: Products uncompetitive in the market
threatDescription: Insufficent knowledge of emerging technologies and market trends
mitigationDescription:
Existing Controls: General interest in technical and industry knowledge by staff members ensures most emerging technologies and market trends are noticed and often discussed.

Potential Additional Controls: Departmental staff could subscribe to appropriate news feed to ensure they are kept up-to-date.
